Variable Description: Median sales price of residential parcels
Definition: Median sales price of residential parcels
Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Definition: Median sales price of single-family parcels
Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Definition: Median sales price of multi-family (2 to 4-family) parcels
Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Definition: Number of arms-length sales of single-family parcels
Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Definition: Number of arms-length sales of multi-family (2 to 4-family) parcels

Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Total count of Part I crimes.  Part I crimes include violent crimes (homicide, rape, robbery and aggravated assaults) and property crimes (burglary, larceny-theft, auto theft and arson).
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County

Definition: Part I crimes rate per 100,000 population
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County
Note: Population used in the calculation of crime rates is based on the population proportion from the 2010 Census and benchmarked it to the American Community Sruvey (ACS) 1-year estimates population.

Definition: Total count of violent crimes.  Violent crimes include four offenses: homicide, rape, robbery, and aggravated assault.
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County

Definition: Violent crimes rate per 100,000 population
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County
Note: Population used in the calculation of crime rates is based on the population proportion from the 2010 Census and benchmarked it to the American Community Sruvey (ACS) 1-year estimates population.

Definition: Total count of property crimes.  Property crimes include the offenses of burglary, larceny-theft, motor vehicle theft, and arson. The offenses involve the taking of money or property, with no force or threat of force against the victims.
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County

Definition: Property crimes rate per 100,000 population
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County
Note: Population used in the calculation of crime rates is based on the population proportion from the 2010 Census and benchmarked it to the American Community Sruvey (ACS) 1-year estimates population.

Definition: Total count of Part II crimes.  Part II crimes include everything else such as non-aggravated assaults, forgery, fraud, embezzlement, receiving stolen property, vandalism,  weapons violations, prostitution, drug violations, family offenses, disorderly conduct, kidnapping and all others.
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County

Definition: Part II crimes rate per 100,000 population
Limitations: Data is not available for Cuyahoga County
Note: Population used in the calculation of crime rates is based on the population proportion from the 2010 Census and benchmarked it to the American Community Sruvey (ACS) 1-year estimates population.

Definition: Count of residential occupancy
Percent of residential occupancy
Count of residential structures per square mile
Limitations: Only residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included

Definition: Count of foreclosure filings. Foreclosure filings represent the beginning of the foreclosure process in Ohio, when a lender files a complaint about a delinquent homeowner.
Limitations: Only residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Parcels are unduplicated, meaning a given parcel is only counted once, even if there are more than one foreclosure filings on that parcel during a given year.

Definition: Percent of foreclosure filings
Limitations: Only residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Foreclosure filings as a percent of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels during a given year.

Definition: Count of sheriff deeds.  Sheriff deeds represent the end of the foreclosure process.  A sheriff deed is granted when a foreclosure has been filed on a property, the homeowner is found in breech of contract, the home is ordered to be sold at sheriff sale and is purchased.
Limitations: Only residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included

Definition: Percent of sheriff deeds
Limitations: Only residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Sheriff's sales as a percent of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels during a given year.

Definition: Count of distressed sales.  Distressed sales are arms-length transactions for $10,000 or less.
Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Definition: Percent of distressed sales
Limitations: Only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels are included
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Variable Description: Sales, parcels with no history of foreclosure
Definition: Count of sales of parcels with no history of foreclosure.
Limitations: Arms-length transactions with no history of foreclosure. Includes only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels. Excludes sales with a sheriff's deed prior to the sale. Sheriff's deed considered from 1995 onward.
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Variable Description: % Sales, parcels with no history of foreclosure
Definition: Percent of sales of parcels with no history of foreclosure.
Limitations: Arms-length transactions with no history of foreclosure. Includes only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels. Excludes sales with a sheriff's deed prior to the sale. Sheriff's deed considered from 1995 onward.
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Variable Description: Median sales price, parcels with no history of foreclosure
Definition: Median sales price of parcels with no history of foreclosure
Universe: Arms-length sales of parcels with no history of foreclosure
Limitations: Arms-length transactions with no history of foreclosure. Includes only arms-length sales of residential single family, multi-family, and condominium parcels. Excludes sales with a sheriff's deed prior to the sale. Sheriff's deed considered from 1995 onward.
Note: Armslength sales include all property sales except those transferred at Sheriff sale, purchased by a bank, financial institution, GSE or local government,  or recorded with a zero price.   Bulk sales and self-sales are also excluded.

Definition: Number of Grade 3 students who are proficient in reading
Universe: Grade 3 students who took the reading test
Limitations: Cleveland Metropolitan School District students only. Data is not available for Cuyahoga County
Note: In the 2014-15 School Year, Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC) tests replaced the Ohio Achievement Assessments (OAA).  PARCC testing will not be continued.  It will be replaced by American Institutes of Research (AIR) tests in the 2015-16 school year.  Since PARCC passage rates cannot be compared with OAA passage rates in the previous years and the AIR passage rates in the forthcoming years, proficiency data for Grades 3, 4 and 6 will not be updated this year.
